title: Does the Bekenstein bound debunk the Simulation Hypothesis? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. it supports it completely. For the same reason that we have a quantifiable minimum scale of the universe we have a limit to the amount of information that can be supported in any given space. No, the Bekenstein bound is based on facts assumed to exist in a physical Universe. Simulation Hypothesis is based on the assumption that the physical universe and facts related to it are all an illusion.

No. The Bekenstein bound (just like any other statement of our physical universe) says nothing about the physical laws of the universe (should it exist) containing the computer simulating our universe.
